explainability.findings: TD SYNNEX documents explainability through blog posts that describe explainability tools and highlight mechanisms for explainability. These posts also discuss the pairing of AI insights with human judgment and articulating the rationale behind decisions.

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post, "AI Governance for the Enterprise - TD SYNNEX," provides evidence for **governance**, **fairness**, **explainability**, and **transparency**. The document describes automated AI governance processes, fairness monitoring mechanisms, and explainability tools, indicating operational governance through actions like evaluating, creating frameworks, and alerting owners. It also mentions AI systems and transparency, supporting the transparency pillar by outlining the purpose of these systems.
relevant_sources.title: AI Governance for the Enterprise - TD SYNNEX

relevant_sources.summary: This TD SYNNEX blog post provides evidence for explainability, external_accountability, fairness, governance, and transparency. The document details operational AI risk management, including risk assessments, policy enforcement, monitoring for bias and drift, and the need for defined roles and documentation, all of which support governance and fairness. Furthermore, it highlights transparency requirements for training datasets and user information, as well as mechanisms for explainability and conformity assessment, contributing to transparency and external_accountability.
relevant_sources.title: Drive AI Safely to Production & Governance - TD SYNNEX

relevant_sources.summary: This blog post provides evidence for **governance** and **fairness** by mentioning a checklist for vetting vendors on responsible AI criteria. governance.findings: TD SYNNEX documents its governance practices through various sources, including Form 10-K filings detailing a Board Technology Committee for generative AI oversight, and proxy statements outlining board structure, committee responsibilities, and the AI Governance Group (DART). Corporate Citizenship Reports describe the Digital and AI Responsible Transformation team and a governance structure for employee AI use. Additionally, privacy statements detail data use for personalization, policy documents reference a Code of Conduct for automated systems, and blog posts describe automated AI governance processes, risk management, and vendor vetting criteria.

relevant_sources.summary: This TD SYNNEX Form 10-K filing provides evidence for the **governance** and **oversight** pillars of responsible AI. The document details the creation of a Board Technology Committee specifically tasked with overseeing generative AI, demonstrating a formal commitment to structured governance and active oversight of AI initiatives.
relevant_sources.title: TD SYNNEX Form 10-K - Fiscal Year Ended November 30, 2024

relevant_sources.summary: This proxy statement provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It supports governance by detailing board structure, committee responsibilities (including those related to AI oversight), and director qualifications. The document also supports transparency by mentioning AI tools, policies for risk and disclosure, and the formation of an AI Governance Group (DART) with a stated purpose.
relevant_sources.title: TD SYNNEX Proxy Statement for 2025 Annual Meeting (DEF 14A)

relevant_sources.summary: This TD SYNNEX FY2024 Corporate Citizenship Report, an audit report, provides evidence for the **governance** pillar of responsible AI. The report details the creation of a Digital and AI Responsible Transformation team, indicating a governance structure for AI adoption and policy development. Furthermore, the report highlights the development of AI-driven solutions for compliance and the establishment of a governance structure for responsible generative AI use by employees, demonstrating a commitment to ethical AI alignment.
relevant_sources.title: TD SYNNEX FY2024 Corporate Citizenship Report

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned privacy policy document provides evidence for the **governance**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It supports governance by detailing data use for personalization and targeted advertising, implying automated systems and third-party data resale. Evidence for privacy is found in its discussion of data use for profiling, inferences, and predictions, as well as opt-out mechanisms for automated systems. Transparency is supported by mentions of applying artificial intelligence and automated decision-making.
relevant_sources.title: Privacy Statement - TD SYNNEX Corporation

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, "TD SYNNEX Statement Against Modern Slavery and Human Trafficking," provides evidence for the **governance** and **privacy** pillars of responsible AI. It supports governance by referencing a Code of Conduct that establishes an accountability framework for automated decision systems and algorithmic processes. The policy also supports privacy by mentioning personalized content matching and profiling for ads, which implies the use of automated systems and the need for consent regarding data usage.
relevant_sources.title: TD SYNNEX Statement Against Modern Slavery and Human Trafficking

relevant_sources.summary: This TD SYNNEX "Data Analytics & AI Line Card" provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. transparency.findings: TD SYNNEX documents transparency through various means, including proxy statements that mention AI tools, risk policies, and the AI Governance Group (DART). Privacy statements mention the application of AI and automated decision-making, while blog posts outline the purpose of AI systems and highlight transparency requirements for training datasets and user information. Additionally, Data Analytics & AI Line Cards describe AI capabilities and solutions for bias detection and explainability.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

summary.overall_findings: Blog posts from TD Synnex detail monitoring for bias and drift, demonstrating operational practices for fairness. All 7 evaluated pillars have documented public evidence, with the assessment drawing from 17 publicly available sources; explainability is also supported by blog posts describing explainability tools. At the policy level, transparency is addressed through proxy statements mentioning policies for risk and disclosure related to AI, and privacy statements discuss data use for profiling, inferences, and predictions. Additionally, Form 10-K filings detail the creation of a Board Technology Committee tasked with overseeing generative AI for both governance and oversight, while external accountability highlights mechanisms for conformity assessment.
